Job Title: Strategic Financial Director 

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Analyst, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Camino Search is thrilled to be partnering a leading private equity backed technology business seeking a Strategic Finance Director to be key player in shaping their long-term business strategy and execution. If you thrive in fast-paced environments, possess exceptional analytical skills, and have a passion for driving growth, we want to hear from you. This role requires a 'start-up' mentality, strong technical skills, and a dedication to making a meaningful impact.

This is an amazing business because:
Mission focused company who truly care about their end customers and the good their customers bring to the world.Low ego leaders who focus on outcomes, not hierarchy.A great business that is performing well but with so many exciting challenges for someone to make an impact upon.Backed by top sponsors who are experts in the sector.
This role will suit some who:
Loves autonomy and searching to create value. Are you real self-starter who seeks to make improvements in all areas of the business?Do you work well with non finance functions? This will collaborate with 12+ different business functions!Thrives when dealing with execs, investors and bringing people together to achieve great things!Is happy to be a 'floating' individual contributor within the company. No direct reports but lots of influencing and leading of people at all levelsA broad FP & A or Strategic finance background, that has a deep understanding of finance, business triggers and finding solutions.A scrappy/gritty individual who can work at pace to get things done!

Responsibilities:
Lead company strategy from a financial perspective, collaborating with other divisions to identify and monitor growth opportunitiesCreate financial and analytical models to measure company revenue and growthDevelop data-driven investment strategies, business cases, and evaluation criteria, providing financial and operating metricsEstablish ROI models and OKRs for key strategic initiativesAnalyze revenue opportunities and investment costs through financial modelingAssist in equity and debt fundraising processesSupport Corporate Development in creating detailed acquisition models and tracking synergiesPrepare Board presentations and investor updates on company performanceCollaborate with the leadership team to develop comprehensive business analysis and financial models/metricsEstablish an enterprise strategic finance function to support decision-making with the provision of data-driven insightsManage future M&A integration effortsAutomation of data flows and reporting
 Required Experience:
Strong executive presenceDeep understanding of financial statements, modeling, analysis and calculating/forecasting Pro Forma EBITDAProven leadership skills with the ability to influence cross-functional teams and exceptional communication skillsExperience in investment banking and/or PE-backed environments is advantageousFamiliarity with large data sets, complex integrations and SaaS platforms

Experience Level (if available): Director
